DataElement.preferredName: Differentiated Thyroid Cancer Less Than Age 55 Years AJCC Edition 8 Group Stage
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Stage group for persons under 55 years of age based on the combination of T, N, and M categories and relevant prognostic factors for differentiated thyroid carcinoma, using AJCC Ed. 8 criteria.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Differentiated Thyroid Gland Carcinoma Less Than Age Fifty Five Year Stage Grouping
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: An adenocarcinoma arising from the thyroid gland showing extensive evidence of follicular cell differentiation.  According to the nuclear features of the malignant follicular cells, it is classified either as papillary, or follicular carcinoma._A statement about the relative size or order of two objects specifying that an object of interest is smaller than another object in quantity or measure or value or status._How long something has existed; elapsed time since birth._A natural number greater than forty-nine and less than fifty-one and the quantity that it denotes._A natural number greater than 4 and less than 6 and the quantity that it denotes: the sum of four and one._A period of time that it takes for Earth to make a complete revolution around the sun, approximately 365 days; a specific one year period._An assessment based on the combined evaluation of the patient's T stage, M stage, and N stage, as well as prognostic parameters for specific cancers.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: An adenocarcinoma arising from the thyroid gland showing extensive evidence of follicular cell differentiation.  According to the nuclear features of the malignant follicular cells, it is classified either as papillary, or follicular carcinoma. (NCI05)

Concepts.definition: An adenocarcinoma that arises from the thyroid gland and shows extensive evidence of follicular cell differentiation.  According to the nuclear features of the malignant follicular cells, it is classified either as papillary or follicular carcinoma.

Property.preferredName: Less Than Age Fifty Five Year Stage Grouping
Property.preferredDefinition: A statement about the relative size or order of two objects specifying that an object of interest is smaller than another object in quantity or measure or value or status.:How long something has existed; elapsed time since birth.:A natural number greater than forty-nine and less than fifty-one and the quantity that it denotes.:A natural number greater than 4 and less than 6 and the quantity that it denotes: the sum of four and one.:A period of time that it takes for Earth to make a complete revolution around the sun, approximately 365 days; a specific one year period.:An assessment based on the combined evaluation of the patient's T stage, M stage, and N stage, as well as prognostic parameters for specific cancers.

Concepts.definition: A statement about the relative size or order of two objects specifying that an object of interest is smaller than another object in quantity or measure or value or status.
How long something has existed; elapsed time since birth.
A natural number greater than forty-nine and less than fifty-one and the quantity that it denotes.
A natural number greater than 4 and less than 6 and the quantity that it denotes: the sum of four and one.
A period of time that it takes for Earth to make a complete revolution around the sun, approximately 365 days; a specific one year period.
An assessment based on the combined evaluation of the patient's T stage, M stage, and N stage, as well as prognostic parameters for specific cancers.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the process of identifying a disease by the signs and symptoms (NCI Glossary).

DataElementConcept.origin: AJCC Based:Staging Criteria Based on American Joint Committee on Cancer System
DataElementConcept.changeDescription: 2020-12-15 TL released. 11/29/18 tmt created for standardization.

ValueDomain.preferredName: Differentiated Thyroid Carcinoma Under 55 Years American Joint Committee on Cancer Edition 8 Group Stage
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A differentiated thyroid gland carcinoma stage for patients under 55 years of age defined according to the AJCC 8th edition criteria._An assessment based on the combined evaluation of the patient's T stage, M stage, and N stage, as well as prognostic parameters for specific cancers._The extent of a cancer in the body. Staging is usually based on the size of the tumor, whether lymph nodes contain cancer, and whether the cancer has spread from the original site to other parts of the body.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Stage II Differentiated Thyroid Gland Carcinoma Under 55 Years AJCC v8

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Stage II Differentiated Thyroid Gland Carcinoma Under 55 Years AJCC v8
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Stage II includes: Any T, Any N, M1. M1: Distant metastasis. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: Stage II Differentiated Thyroid Gland Carcinoma Under 55 Years AJCC v8
Concepts.definition: Stage II includes: Any T, Any N, M1. M1: Distant metastasis. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Stage I Differentiated Thyroid Gland Carcinoma Under 55 Years AJCC v8

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Stage I Differentiated Thyroid Gland Carcinoma Under 55 Years AJCC v8
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Stage I includes: Any T, Any N, M0. M0: No distant metastasis. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: Stage I Differentiated Thyroid Gland Carcinoma Under 55 Years AJCC v8
Concepts.definition: Stage I includes: Any T, Any N, M0. M0: No distant metastasis. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the process of identifying a disease by the signs and symptoms (NCI Glossary).
